str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
Of Chaldee origin; fig-house; Beth-phage, a place in Palestine.
Of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
An olive tree; the Mount of Olives. Feminine of a presumed derivative from an obsolete primary; an olive.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
